page.title: 06A TYPICAL SOUTH LAKES FARM
page.content: CROSBY LODGE FARM. { The farm which was chosen for the study was CROSBY LODGE,at Ackenthwaite near Milnthorpe.Mr.E.W.Melling is the proprietor of Crosby Lodge and has been so since taking over from his father.The farm dates back to 1749 and has been recently modernised.Crosby Lodge is a dairy farm although sheep are also kept on the farm.The land extends to 56 hectares in all,rising to 200ft in places.Crosby Lodge faces south-west.The land is divided up into 20 fields.Only 3 hectares is given to arable land and only one crop is grown,barley.This is used on the farm as cattle fodder.The rest of the land is given to grass which is used for pasture,hay and silage.His livestock consists of 120 holstein dairy cattle and 60 ewes which are kept for lambing.The 3 products sold off the
